newsitem.title: DUBAI: PRESS DIGEST - United Arab Emirates - Aug 13.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - United Arab Emirates - Aug 13.

text.p: These are some of the leading stories in the United Arab Emirates' press on Wednesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Traffic authorities in the UAE will implement Anti-Pollution Act on September 1. Traffic patrols will monitor streets and experts will inspect automobiles.
- The Dubai Criminal Court sentences a 22-year-old stateless man to four years' jail followed by deportation for taking and dealing with drugs.
- The first Internet exhibition in the Middle East will be held at Dubai World Trade Centre from February 17 to 20 next year, the official UAE news agency WAM reported.
- The commissioning of Sharjah's Hamriya Refinery has been rescheduled for around the end of January, general manager of Sharjah Oil Refining Co said.
- The UAE plans to eradicate illiteracy by the year 2000, a report says.
- Dubai authorities arrest a UAE national on charges of impersonating the police and four Africans for stealing gold chains worth 18,000 dirhams.
- Civil Aviation Directorate in Abu Dhabi issues contract for the development of the airport building and the duty-free area via a foreign company.
- Switzerland boosts non-oil trade with the UAE to 665.6 million dirhams in the first half of this year. South Korea's exports to the UAE in 1996 amounted to 2.26 billion dirhams.
- UAE President Sheikh Zaid bin Sultan al-Nahayan arrives in the United States for medical check-ups.
